segments.text: Ladies and gentlemen, Ali Sadiq.
What up, though?
I'm finna start.
So, you know how they say,
easy like Sunday morning?
Yeah, Lionel Richie said that song,
Marcus say that all the time.
He say, it's easy like Sunday morning.
And I get that.
But Monday.
Monday is hard for some strange reason.
I don't care if you unemployed,
if you employed or you own your own business,
whatever you're doing, Monday is hard.
I'm gonna tell y'all four stories.
All of them started on Monday.
And I'm gonna go in order.
So, this particular Monday,
I'm doing what I normally do.
I go to this gym, Main Street Boxing Gym,
1612 Austin Street.
Yeah, I'd say that real bold.
If anybody tried me, you know what I'm really at.

I get to town.

That's when I'm there,
because I leave town on Thursdays.

I walk into the gym.
I'm having a pretty good day.
And I get there at 5.30 a.m.
Yeah, 5.30 a.m. in there doing my thing.
Okay.

it's some guys already in the ring, sparring.

I am immediately offended

in the morning.

hey man, you done, your ass outta here.
